main event: A possible satellite sighting was reported in Farming, Michigan on March 2, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright, silver-white object that was gliding for a short period.
The object suddenly took off vertically in an instant and disappeared to the north.
The object was visible for approximately 5 minutes.
The observer noted the brightness of the light as first drawing their attention to the object.
The report indicates the object's flight path was a straight path before the sudden vertical takeoff.
